titleStmt.title: Letter, James L. Dodds in Camp Meade, Md., to Ellen Smith in Jackson, Tenn.,1918 Jan. 14

publicationStmt.publisher: The University of Tennessee Libraries Digital Initiatives

bibl.title: Letter, James L. Dodds in Camp Meade, Md., to Ellen Smith in Jackson, Tenn.,1918 Jan. 14

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

revisionDesc.change: Approximate date of original transcription and transcriber.
Migrating from P4 to validated TEI P5.

div.p: Miss Ellen Smith,
111 Hatton Street,
Jackson,
Tenn,
Camp Meade Md.
Dear Ellen:
Well I will write you this afternoon and tell you how to address My Mail. I will leave Camp Meade tomorrow I dont know where I am going for sure but I thank will go to Laurel Virginia
I have been asigned to Company L. I have just found out that it is Laurel Maryland enstid of Virginia. I am pretty sure we will go there.
I had a letter from Esther at noon tell her I will write her just as soon as I get to where I am going
And if you see any of Aunt
Annie folks tell them for me I wont have time to write to all of them And tell them to tell the rest of My Aunts and Uncles there If you will do this I will appreciate it very murch
I will get the mail that is adds to Recruiting Detachment but will take a long time
They are moving all the 23 Engineers out of this Camp they are sending 4 Companys to France in a few days and looks now like we will all follow them just as fast as Can get ready
I dont think the first of March will find Me in good Old U.S.A. but across the pond by then.
I am glad I am leaving here. I have been in quarantine since the first of Jan and dont see any chance to get out as long as I stay here Maybe I will have a little pleasure where I go
I havent been any where at all since I have been here not out of Camp only on hike
I havent spoke to a lady in a month. I would like to just say hello to one and see how I would feel You know that dont suit Me at all but I have to do a lot of things in the Army I dont like
The weather is some warmer here to day and believe Me I am
glad to see it for I have all Most froze. I guess if the weather turns cold down at Laurel I will freeze for we will be in tents there
The boys are all glad we are leaving here they are running around saying O boy O joy where do we go from here That is a saying in the army
I will write you again when we stop and if you will tell Auntie I will be oblige
as Ever James L Dodds
address like this
23 Engineers, Company, L.
Camp Meade
Maryland
They will send My Mail to me where ever I go with that address
